item.title: Russell add a quote by Frank Zappa
item.description: "So many books, so little time." -- Frank Zappa

item.title: Russell add a quote by Dr. Seuss
item.description: "Don't cry because it's over, smile because it happened." -- Dr. Seuss

item.title: Russell add a quote by Bernard M. Baruch
item.description: "Be who you are and say what you feel, because those who mind don't matter, and those who matter don't mind." -- Bernard M. Baruch

item.title: Russell add a quote by Margaret Mead
item.description: "Never doubt that a small group of thoughtful, committed, citizens can change the world. Indeed, it is the only thing that ever has." -- Margaret Mead

item.title: Russell add a quote by Maya Angelou
item.description: "There is no greater agony than bearing an untold story inside you." -- Maya Angelou

item.title: Russell add a quote by Thomas A. Edison
item.description: "Many of life's failures are people who did not realize how close they were to success when they gave up." -- Thomas A. Edison

item.title: Russell add a quote by Aristotle
item.description: "Knowing yourself is the beginning of all wisdom." -- Aristotle

item.title: Russell add a quote by Antoine de Saint-Exupéry
item.description: "Goodbye," said the fox. "And now here is my secret, a very simple secret: It is only with the heart that one can see rightly; what is essential is invisible to the eye." -- Antoine de Saint-Exupéry

item.title: Russell add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "I speak to everyone in the same way, whether he is the garbage man or the president of the university." -- Albert Einstein

item.title: Russell add a quote by Milan Kundera
item.description: "Two people in love, alone, isolated from the world, that's beautiful." -- Milan Kundera

item.title: Russell add a quote by Mitch Albom
item.description: "Death ends a life, not a relationship." -- Mitch Albom

item.title: Russell add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "Creativity is knowing how to hide your sources" -- Albert Einstein

item.title: Russell add a quote by Leonardo da Vinci
item.description: "A painter should begin every canvas with a wash of black, because all things in nature are dark except where exposed by the light." -- Leonardo da Vinci

item.title: Russell add a quote by Albert Camus
item.description: "Don't walk behind me; I may not lead. Don't walk in front of me; I may not follow. Just walk beside me and be my friend." -- Albert Camus

item.title: Russell add a quote by Arthur C. Clarke
item.description:
"My favourite definition of an intellectual: 'Someone who has been educated beyond his/her intelligence.
[<i>Sources and Acknowledgements</i>: Chapter 19]" -- Arthur C. Clarke

item.title: Russell add a quote by Gary Starta
item.description: "It's hard to be a bright light in a dim world." -- Gary Starta

item.title: Russell add a quote by William Shakespeare
item.description: "All's well if all ends well." -- William Shakespeare

item.title: Russell add a quote by Charles J. Sykes
item.description: "Be nice to nerds. You may end up working for them. We all could." -- Charles J. Sykes

item.title: Russell add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "All women become like their mothers. That is their tragedy. No man does, and that is his." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Russell add a quote by Nicole Krauss
item.description: "Once upon a time there was a boy who loved a girl, and her laughter was a question he wanted to spend his whole life answering." -- Nicole Krauss

item.title: Russell add a quote by J.M. Barrie
item.description: "Those who bring sunshine to the lives of others cannot keep it from themselves." -- J.M. Barrie

item.title: Russell add a quote by steve martin
item.description: "I believe that sex is one of the most beautiful, natural, wholesome things that money can buy." -- steve martin

item.title: Russell add a quote by William W. Purkey
item.description: "You've gotta dance like there's nobody watching, Love like you'll never be hurt, Sing like there's nobody listening, And live like it's heaven on earth." -- William W. Purkey

item.title: Russell add a quote by Marianne Williamson
item.description: "Our deepest fear is not that we are inadequate. Our deepest fear is that we are powerful beyond measure. It is our light, not our darkness that most frightens us. We ask ourselves, 'Who am I to be brilliant, gorgeous, talented, fabulous?' Actually, who are you not to be? You are a child of God. Your playing small does not serve the world. There is nothing enlightened about shrinking so that other people won't feel insecure around you. We are all meant to shine, as children do. We were born to make manifest the glory of God that is within us. It's not just in some of us; it's in everyone. And as we let our own light shine, we unconsciously give other people permission to do the same. As we are liberated from our own fear, our presence automatically liberates others." -- Marianne Williamson

item.title: Russell add a quote by Mahatma Gandhi
item.description: "First they ignore you, then they ridicule you, then they fight you, and then you win." -- Mahatma Gandhi

item.title: Russell add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "Always forgive your enemies; nothing annoys them so much." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Russell add a quote by Dr. Seuss
item.description: "You have brains in your head. You have feet in your shoes. You can steer yourself any direction you choose. You're on your own. And you know what you know. And YOU are the one who'll decide where to go..." -- Dr. Seuss

item.title: Russell add a quote by Dr. Seuss
item.description: "Sometimes the questions are complicated and the answers are simple." -- Dr. Seuss

item.title: Russell add a quote by William Shakespeare
item.description: "Love me or hate me, both are in my favor…If you love me, I'll always be in your heart…If you hate me, I'll always be in your mind." -- William Shakespeare

item.title: Russell add a quote by Milan Kundera
item.description: "The bloody massacre in Bangladesh quickly covered over the memory of the Russian invasion of Czechoslovakia, the assassination of Allende drowned out the groans of Bangladesh, the war in the Sinai Desert made people forget Allende, the Cambodian massacre made people forget Sinai, and so on and so forth until ultimately everyone lets everything be forgotten." -- Milan Kundera
